summary.p: Bullinger will receive a response to his letter [No. 941] in the next few days. Blarer thanks for the commentaries on the Pauline epistles. Greetings. He will show his appreciation for Bibliander's poem.

div.p: Greetings. Your letters are not neglected by me, most kind Bullinger, and although it is not happening now, in the coming days you will receive a message that will meet your expectations, so I ask you not to be anxious.
We have received your commentaries on the Pauline epistles, a most serious and delightful token of your friendship towards our families and also of your diligence in the Christian commonwealth.
Convey my greetings and those of the people of Zurich to all the pious and learned, especially to the consul RÃ¶sch himself.
If you give me Theodore's verses, I will repay you.
To Lord Heinrich Bullinger, herald of the evangelical truth among the people of Zurich, his venerable lord and friend. Zurich.
